Key Match Events: England won by 20 runs against New Zealand.
Sam Curran and Chris Woakes excelled with the ball.
Daryl Mitchell and Glenn Phillips were caught by Chris Jordan.
Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler approached the game with a fresh outlook, choosing to bat first.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed satisfaction with his captaincy decisions and the team's performance.
England emerged with fresh confidence in their ability, approach, and captain.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Moeen Ali bowled for the first time in the tournament and took the opening over.
Mark Wood bowled the last over of the powerplay.
Chris Jordan replaced Liam Livingstone due to an ankle soreness and took crucial catches.
New Zealand's captain, Kane Williamson, used spinners early to target England's right-handed openers.
